description.en: This ontology contains a preliminary list of properties that might prove useful to describe heritage buildings. Besides two taxonomies of general built heritage properties, extending resp. contax:property_OP and contax:property_DP, it also contains terminology for the more specific patterns related to construction assessments (extending the more generic Construction Properties (CP) taxonomy). The properties are inspired by (1) the databases of Monumentenwacht Vlaanderen (MAKSBO and IMACS), (2) the online built heritage inventory of Onroerend Erfgoed Vlaanderen and (3) the results of interviews with a large variety of Flemish built heritage stakeholders.

comment.en: Quantitative property to indicate the percentage of the roof that is provided with safety hooks for ladders and/or fall protection that comply with the European standard EN 517. Property definition inspired by the Monumentenwacht Vlaanderen databases (MAKSBO and IMACS).
A property to connect a spatial building zone or construction component to a historical source that describes it. Property definition inspired by interviews with built heritage stakeholders.
A property to connect a spatial building zone to a historical event that took place in the building zone. Property definition inspired by interviews with built heritage stakeholders.

Property to assign a function to a certain built heritage building. For the Flemish context, predefined property values can be used from ET-BUILDINGS taxonomy, based on the Onroerend Erfgoed thesaurus "ERFGOEDTYPES", and the AAT-BUILDINGS taxonomy based on the Getty AAT. Property definition inspired by the Monumentenwacht Vlaanderen databases (MAKSBO and IMACS).
Property to indicate the architectural style of as spatial building zone or a construction component. Property definition inspired by interviews with built heritage stakeholders.

Property to assign an original function to a certain built heritage building. For the Flemish context, predefined property values can be used from ET-BUILDINGS taxonomy, based on the Onroerend Erfgoed thesaurus "ERFGOEDTYPES", and the AAT-BUILDINGS taxonomy based on the Getty AAT. Property definition inspired by the Monumentenwacht Vlaanderen databases (MAKSBO and IMACS).

Property to assign a past function (different from the original function) to a certain built heritage building. For the Flemish context, predefined property values can be used from ET-BUILDINGS taxonomy, based on the Onroerend Erfgoed thesaurus "ERFGOEDTYPES", and the AAT-BUILDINGS taxonomy based on the Getty AAT. Property definition inspired by the Monumentenwacht Vlaanderen databases (MAKSBO and IMACS).

Quantitative property to indicate the percentage of the roof that is provided with safety hooks for ladders and/or fall protection. Property definition inspired by the Monumentenwacht Vlaanderen databases (MAKSBO and IMACS).

Property to assign a heritage value to a certain built heritage object (spatial building zone or individual construction component). For the Flemish context, predefined property values can be used from the Onroerend Erfgoed thesaurus "WAARDETYPES". Property definition inspired by the Onroerend Erfgoed Vlaanderen built heritage inventory.

Property to indicate the building physical condition (BPC) of an assessment (cp:Assessment) connected to an assessed object (cp:hasAssessment) according to the methodology of Monumentenwacht Vlaanderen. According to the methodology of Monumentenwacht, this type of assessment should be performed for each of the following six parts of an inspected construction: (1) the construction a whole, (2) the roof(s), (3) the rain water disposal system, (4) the roof structure(s), (5) the general load bearing structure and (6) the framework and glazing of doors and windows. 

The value of the property should be a positive integer between 1 and 6. The scale should be interpretted as follows:
1 = excellent
2 = good
3 = fair
4 = average
5 = bad
6 = very bad

label.en: risk for consequential damage score (according Monumentenwacht)

comment.en:
Property to indicate the risk for consequential damage (in case the owner does not react properly to the detected damages) of an assessment (cp:Assessment) connected to an assessed object (cp:hasAssessment) connected to an assessed object (cp:hasAssessment) according to the methodology of Monumentenwacht Vlaanderen. According to the methodology of Monumentenwacht, this type of assessment should be performed for each of the following six parts of an inspected construction: (1) the construction a whole, (2) the roof(s), (3) the rain water disposal system, (4) the roof structure(s), (5) the general load bearing structure and (6) the framework and glazing of doors and windows. 

The value of the property should be a positive integer between 1 and 6. The scale should be interpretted as follows:
1 = no risk
2 = low risk
3 = fair risk
4 = considerable risk
5 = high risk
6 = acute risk

Property to connect a built heritage buildig or site to an "erfgoed beheersplan", as defined by Onroerend Erfgoed Vlaanderen. Property definition inspired by interviews with built heritage stakeholders.

Property to assign a heritage protection type to a certain built heritage site or building. For the Flemish context, two predefined property values can be used from the Onroerend Erfgoed thesaurus "AANDUIDINGSTYPES". Property definition inspired by the Onroerend Erfgoed Vlaanderen built heritage inventory.

Property to indicate the attitude and quality of the current maintenance policies of an assessment (cp:Assessment) connected to an assessed object (cp:hasAssessment) according to the methodology of Monumentenwacht Vlaanderen. According to the methodology of Monumentenwacht, this type of assessment should be performed for each of the following six parts of an inspected construction: (1) the construction a whole, (2) the roof(s), (3) the rain water disposal system, (4) the roof structure(s), (5) the general load bearing structure and (6) the framework and glazing of doors and windows. 

The value of the property should be a positive integer between 1 and 6. The scale should be interpretted as follows:
1 = excellent
2 = good
3 = fair
4 = average
5 = bad
6 = very bad

Property to assign a current function to a certain built heritage building. An alternative way of modeling the current function of a building is by attaching the appropriate class (specialization of bot:Building) to the building node via an rdf:type relation. For the Flemish context, predefined property values can be used from ET-BUILDINGS taxonomy, based on the Onroerend Erfgoed thesaurus "ERFGOEDTYPES", and the AAT-BUILDINGS taxonomy based on the Getty AAT. Property definition inspired by the Monumentenwacht Vlaanderen databases (MAKSBO and IMACS).

Property to relate a (recent or historic) restoration architect to a site, building or individual construction component. Famous architects with assigned URIs from the Getty ULAN vocabulary can be used as values for this property. Property definition inspired by the Onroerend Erfgoed Vlaanderen built heritage inventory.
Property to indicate the historical time period a spatial building zone or a construction component originates from. Property definition inspired by interviews with built heritage stakeholders.

Property to relate an original architect to a site, building or individual construction component. Famous architects with assigned URIs from the Getty ULAN vocabulary can be used as values for this property. Property definition inspired by the Onroerend Erfgoed Vlaanderen built heritage inventory.

Property to relate an architect to a site, building or individual construction component. Famous architects with assigned URIs from the Getty ULAN vocabulary can be used as values for this property. Specializations of this property can be used to assign the original architect (bhp:originalArchitect) or (recent or historic) restoration architects (bhp:restorationArchitect). Property definition inspired by the Onroerend Erfgoed Vlaanderen built heritage inventory.
